newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - U.S. Robotics trades up.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - U.S. Robotics trades up.

text.p: U.S. Robotics was trading at 48 in after-hours trading against a Nasdaq close of 47 after the company reported second-quarter earnings of $0.95 a share against $0.55 for the same period last year.
Robotics reported its earnings after the close of the market on Wednesday.
First Call's consensus among analysts forecast its earnings at $0.75 a share.
One dealer said trading was at its usual frenetic pace during corporate earnings period.
Netscape Communications Corp was trading at 27-3/8 compared to its close of 27-1/2 following the release of its quarterly earnings.
"It's pretty much in line," said one dealer.
The Internet software company reported first-quarter profit of $0.09 a share against $0.04 for the same period a year ago.
Meanwhile, Computer Associates International Inc's stock rose to 47 from a close of 44 on the New York Stock Exchange after it made projections for the fourth quarter and year.
Its stock was later halted for over-the-counter trading.

Computer Associates said it foresaw earnings per share for the quarter to reach $0.90 on revenues of $1.2 billion. Earnings for the year would total $2.54 a share on revenues of about $4.0 billion, it said, adding that the full-year results would include a $598-million charge.
First Call's consensus among analysts forecast a fourth-quarter profit of $0.86 a share and $2.51 for the year.
International Business Machines Corp's stock was halted before the company released its first quarter earnings after normal trading hours.
The New York Stock Exchange said Wednesday that session one had a volume of 116,100 shares against 47,200 the previous day. Session two had 6.0 million shares against 9.4 million, it added.
